resources.string: If you want to be healthy in the age of technology, this is the app for you!
How many calories would you like to consume?
What Kind Of Workout Would You Like To Do?
Do you have a gym membership already?
If so, enter in the name of your gym, otherwise "no"
Is there a particular activity you want to do today?
If so, enter in the name
Enter in your food consumption details for today
List any known food allergies you have; say none if you have none
Enter details of your diet plan, if you have one; say "none" if you do not
Breakfast: Cereal Bar.\nLunch: Rice, yogurt, pulverized tomato extract.
Trying to eat less fat and more food that helps build strength

Since you calorie intake so far today is between 500 and 750, we recommend that you eat some type of vegetable dish. Maybe eat some eggplant since it will help you develop strength and has a lot of nutrients that you need.
1 cup flour, 1/2 tsp carom seeds, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper powder, and a pinch of asafoetida, 5mm raw eggplant slices\n

Mix the dry ingredients (everything besides the eggplant pieces) well. Add cold water and make sure no lumps are formed. The batter should have the same consistency as pancake batter. Dip the eggplant pieces into the batter and deep fry in hot oil. Reduce the heat after the eggplant pieces are dropped in oil and fry until they are a beige-ish color. Then remove them and place them on a paper towel to drain excess oil. You can eat them plain, or with ketchup or pulverized cilantro.
Starving? Try making some of these 300 calorie sloppy joes.
1lb lean ground beef, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon prepared yellow mustard, 3/4 cup ketchup, 3 teaspoons brown sugar

In a medium skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef, onion, and green pepper; drain off liquids. Stir in the mustard, ketchup, and brown sugar; mix thoroughly. Reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Craving some simple soup comfort food? Try some delicious, 400 calorie seafood soup!

1tbsp olive oil, 1tsp fennel seeds, 2 diced carrots, 2 diced celery sticks, 2 chopped garlic cloves 2 sliced leeks, 400g canned chopped tomatoes, 500ml hot fish stock, 2 skinless polic fillets, 85g raw shelled king prawns

Heat the oil in a large pan, add the fennel seeds, carrots, celery and garlic, and cook for 5 mins until starting to soften. Tip in the leeks, tomatoes and stock, season and bring to the boil, then cover and simmer for 15-20 mins until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened and reduced slightly. Add the fish, scatter over the prawns and cook for 2 mins more until lightly cooked. Ladle into bowls and serve with a spoon.
Hate dropping your fruit cup everywhere? Just blend it all into a smoothie! This 640 calorie drink is perfect on a hot summer day or a trip to the gym.
2 cup frozen straberries, 1/2 cup crushed pineapple, 1/2 cup water, 1 banana, 6tbsp super, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 2 tbsp honey
Is it skip day yet? Some high calorie dessert for bulking up, but it still needs to be healthy! Disclaimer: this is 1070 calories!!
1/2 cup heavy whipped cream, 3 tbsp creamy peanut butter, 3 tbsp chocolate syrup, 1.5 cup chocolate ice cream
Each donut muffin is only 57 calories, but be careful! Don\'t stuff 10 into your mouth in one sitting!
1 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup melted margarine, 3/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1/2 cup milk, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 cup flour, 1 tsp ground cinnamon

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 24 mini-muffin cups. Mix 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup margarine, and nutmeg in a large bowl. Stir in the milk, then mix in the baking powder and flour until just combined. Fill the prepared mini muffin cups about half full. Bake in the preheated oven until the tops are lightly golden, 15 to 20 minutes. While muffins are baking, place 1/4 cup of melted margarine in a bowl. In a separate bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of sugar with the cinnamon. Remove muffins from their cups, dip each muffin in the melted margarine, and roll in the sugar-cinnamon mixture. Let cool and serve.
Eggs and ham aren\'t just breakfast foods, but they definitely can be. This is recipe is food for breakfast and lunch at 570 calories.

1/2 cup butter, 1 small chopped onion, 1.5 shredded cheddar cheese, 1 can sliced mushrooms, 1 can sliced black olives, chopped cooked ham, sliced jalapeno peppers, 12 scrambled eggs, 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 tsp salt and pepper

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat, and cook the onion until tender. Spread Cheddar cheese in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Layer with mushrooms, olives, sauteed onion, ham, and jalapeno peppers. In a bowl, scramble eggs together with milk, and season with salt and pepper. Pour egg mixture over ingredients, but do not stir. Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until no longer runny in the center and slightly brown on top. Allow to cool slightly, then cut into squares and serve.
Click here to view and sign up for mental health-related events in your area.

Please enter in the 2-letter abbreviation of your state below.

"Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."

1. Lay flat on the floor. 
 2. Place your hands in front of you a little wider than shoulder width. 
 3. Push up while keeping you body parallel to the ground. 
 4. Go down till your elbows are roughly 90 degrees to the ground. 
 5. Continue to repeat this process till you need rest.

1. Find a chair and face it forward. 
 2. Standing backwards, place your hands on the seat of the chair. 
 3. Go down till your elbows are roughly 90 degrees to the chair. 
 4. Push yourself up. Repeat this process till you need rest.

1. Lay flat on the floor. 
 2. Place your hands in front of you at shoulder width. 
 3. Push up while keeping you body parallel to the ground. 
 4. Go down till your elbows are roughly 90 degrees to the ground. 
 5. Continue to repeat this process till you need rest.

1. Lie on your back with your body flat to the ground. 
 2. Place your hands behind your head and your elbows flat to the ground. 
 3. As you curl forward, make sure your left elbow touches your right knee. 
 4. Rotate your body and let your right elbow touch your left knee. 
 5. Repeat this process till you need rest.

1. Find a wall or a solid vertical surface. 
 2. Using the wall, perform a handstand. 
 3. Slowly, go down till your arms are parallel to the ground. 
 4. Slowly go back up. 
 5. Repeat this process till you need rest.

1. Begin in a standing position. 
 2. Step forward with your right leg. 
 3. Lower your body till the left leg is roughly 90 degrees. 
 4. Push yourself up with your right leg. 
 5. Repeat the process alternating the legs. Repeat till you need rest.
